This is the only bar north of Broadway and west of Franklin where I have even the remotest chance of getting laid. 

They also have cans of Pabst and Tecate for sale like every night -- which is partly why that chance remains remote.
author: Chris R.

description:
Very solid bar. I have only been there during daytime hours, during last year's Opening Day of baseball when I was in town for the A's - Red Sox Opening game. VERY friendly crowd that was on the older side (at least during the day - I heard it gets pretty "Fratty" at night. The bartender was excellent, he was a bit gruff, but in the way a good bartender is supposed too be. Like, he'd get me a drink without being asked (I'd only been in there twice and the second day he remembered my name, where I was from, and that I drank PBR), but he always acted like he was a bit annoyed to be doing it. I'm looking for service, not a friend, and he met that expectation. 
Extra points for making sure each TV was tuned to a different ballgame. 
What a neighborhood watering hole should be. I was an outsider, but it really did seem that everyone knew each other and it was a real neighborhood meeting place.
author: Christopher R.

description:
This place was really cool. i rarely go out in this are of the city because of live near USF and it is just such a hassle getting across town, but last night I had some friends in from Los Angeles and they wanted to go out near their hotel so...

Long story short, i had a blast. met some great people, played pool, enjoyed good Irish drinking music (although after 12 it got switched to rap, which was unfortunate) 

I definitely recommend this place if you want to hang out and shoot pool and watch crazy videos on the TV's with friends.
author: Adam W.

description:
Bus stop is my number one.  I spent my 21st birthday there and the kind bartender forced a shot of vodka up my nose with a straw.  As bad as things have gotten inside, they never refuse an open tab and a warm smile.  I have only been kicked out twice and they were both my fault.  This, coupled with the very nice crowd of people working there make it more fun every time I go back.  

My only complaint is when 49er fans don't get rowdy enough.
author: Patrick M.

description: Stopped in here for a quick beer, definitely a cool little place. I especially admired how they had Arrogant Bastard on tap... you don't see too many places with obscure micro-brews on tap these days. Stone ftw.
author: Anthony L.

description:
strong drinks and great football games.

(new review inserted here)
I do love this place for mid-afternoon sports.  Baseball, College Football (UCLA all the way), ro just meeting with friends before you go out for the evening.

The drink specials are really good deals and not only for cheap beer or well drinks.  Happy Hour is half off everything.

I guess if you get over the SC frat-guys and the former frat guy business men, you cna have a great time here.
(end of new rewiew)

Not the best place to meet people (except of course all those kids you went to high school with)

Seems to be the escape route on Tuesday Taco Night when Blue Light turns into a round robin red rover tournament.
author: Mike V.

description: Excellent Bloody Mary's! Great neighborhood bar. Was there for entire football game. Waitress never asked if needed drinks (and she wasn't that busy), had to keep going to the bar, but the bartenders were great, very friendly and helpful.
author: Aimee G.

description:
I've only one had one experience here,  the crowd was very cliquish.  Didn't matter though I was with a group of drunken raging dudes so no worries.

It was a Saturday night, place was packed full of people.  Impossible to take more than a few steps in any direction.  I hate that.  The place is noisy as hell, couldn't have a conversation to someone you were standing right next to.  I hate that too.

Another thing that was funny, yet foul was the bathroom situation.  They have a trough style urinal, so the bathroom ends up smelling like intense urine.  

The one toilet they had someone had threw in a whole roll of TP making it impossible to flush and proceeded to diarrhea on top of it. It was so funny yet absolutely disgusting, I almost vomited from the smell.  

The cheap drinks are good, the rest of the scene is not my style, but I'm glad I have my poo story.
author: Eric L.

description:
The Bus Stop is my "nowhere else," bar. 

"Nowhere else to go? Alright, let's go to the Bus Stop."

It's conveniently located right around the corner from my house so when I need a quick fix and am in the mood for a decent crowd, I'll take a stroll up the hill and park it on one of their stools. I've also been known to watch a big game or two on the tubes. 

Their cocktails are pretty standard but they do offer some great daily specials which I always try to take advantage of. This place serves up your typical Marina crowd, so if you're not in to that, I would stay clear.
author: Julia N.

description:
Ms. PacMan table?  Check.
Golden Tee?  Check.
A bunch o' televisions on a bunch o' channels?  Check.
Fifteen beers on tap?  CHECK.
Surly service with a nod and a wink?  Oh, yeah, check.

Yep, there exists a bar in the Marina that's not full of pansy boys and fake women.  That'd be the Bus Stop.  I'd stopped in here a ways back in between jewelry stores (I was shopping for an engagement ring), and I was miraculously saved from wobbly knees with a pretty good jukebox and a well-layered Black Velvet (pear cider with Guinness layered on top).  Sat at Ms PacMan and got munched fairly quickly by Inky (or was it Blinky?).  Doesn't matter.

Just hung out there tonight a bit with a buddy of mine, between his shopping at jewelry stores for an engagement ring of his own (superstition be damned!).  Went to the back room to play a few rounds of pool, and DAMN!  I would have to say that out of all of the bar tables I've played on in recent memory, these would have to be the best in a while.  Red felt, plenty of chalk, fairly straight cues, and a smoking patio right to the left of the playing field.

I usually avoid the Marina like a cold sore, but if ever I'm in the area, this is probably where you can find me.  Good drinks, good barkeeps, a constant barrage of telly, and some good games going on ... what gives?  All in all, a pretty damn cool bar.
author: Thomas B.

description:
I don't so much remember too much about this place which i'm not sure if that reflects well on the bus stop or the bars I went to before hand.  i'll give it 4 stars cause my friend's roommate bartends there.

i went again the other night.  sketchy things happen here, minus a star
author: Lindsay T.

description:
I'm yet another that learned of this place because of Georgia Bulldogs connection! This was only the second time I had been to the Marina (not my scene), but I'll definitely be coming back for the rest of the season...and however long the Bus Stop can continue being SF's home for [nothin' finder in the land than] drunk, obnoxious Georgia fans!

Of course, I love that there's a place in to watch UGA games, but the Bus Stop earned its stars for having great beer prices and doing its best to keep 'em comin', despite the place being almost unbearably overcrowded.
author: Derek R.

description:
So, this is a place where everything is happening and everyone feels welcome. 

I went for the first time a few weeks ago for happy hour and I had a lot of fun. I was in a really bad mood after I had the longest taxi ride of my life, due to heavy traffic.

The drinks are inexpensive and strong. The server, Emily, who I discovered to be the best server at Jillian's was the cocktail waitress and that made me really happy. She is funny, quick, and adds a special energy to the room.

They have a lot of televisions. When I went, I was able to watch the vice-Presidential debate and the baseball playoffs, which you can't do very easily in San Francisco. 

I had my drinks, then I started craving chicken wings. Emily brought over a menu from a marina restaurant, my friend and I ate the wings, and then the Pizza arrived!

This is the best part. When happy hour ends, they order Amici's pizza for everyone at the bar. I really enjoyed it, but I am glad I had wings, as I only had a piece of pizza, I didn't want to take advantage of the bar my first time going.

I highly suggest this place to any age group, 20's, 30's, 40's..... It's just a mix of everyone just having fun.
author: Christopher W.

description:
So, I had to wait outside for a while, which is fine, my friend got in before they shut the doors and saved us some stools at the bar. We stood outside, had a nice cigarette with some new "waiting in line together" friends. 

Finally got inside and it was packed to the gils with jock types who hadn't realized they graduated college 10 years ago, and that their third string football team membership wasn't impressing anyone other than each other. The women were very, very.... VERY drunk. Most looked on the verge of puking, and it was only 11.  At one point, one of these college bros leaned on me like a chair while I sat at the bar with my friends. 

All that said, the bartender was a cool guy, bouncer was nice, let me outside to smoke and back in without waiting in line. TVs were great for watching sports if that's your sort of thing. Looked like they might have had food during the day? Not sure. I think it'd be a decent place to have a beer and watch a game, just not for a Saturday night when there's football on TV.
author: Mckay W.

description:
Lisa V is right; all roads TRULY lead to this bar!!!  Awesome daily drink deals (I simply can't say no to $3 Absoluts on Thursdays!)
Other great perks:  random free pizza, internet jukebox (but pricey!),pool tables, and literally "the bus stop" for the 45. (If you see one go by, you know you have time for ONE MORE DRINK!)
Not so great:  lost cell phone incidents, hangovers, and one of SF's tiniest bathrooms!  Beware of squealing drunk Marina sorority girl types(unless that's your thing) on friday & saturday nights; otherwise a very cool bar!
author: Michelle L.

description: New to the city or just looking for new friends then check out Bus Stop. Its a place where a mix crowd is drinking spirits while in good spirits! You are going to bump elbows but that is the best way to start small talk. Then before you know it you have joined a birthday party, got new hiking partner or met a common college alumni (Go VOLS).
author: Justin C.

description: Too crazy for me on the weekends but on a Sunday night it can be alright. Used to go here with the ex-gf, swilled a lot of beer, and had small talk with all the other Sunday lushes. I'm guessing it makes a great locals bar during the week but is to mostly be avoided during the weekend crush.
author: Kim N.

description: People say a lot of things about this place, but I love it.  I've always had a good time.  You really have to be open minded and just want to have a good time.  They ALWAYS have great drink specials.  The juke box is great as well as the pool tables.  There's definitely an interesting mix of people at this place.  If you're looking for a LOUNGe, This is NOT it.  But its fun if you're just looking for a place to drink and have fun with a group of friends or even watch sporting events.
author: Ronjini M.

description:
Always a lively crowd, Great drink specials, but something tells me I'd like this place more if I were really into college football and liked crushings things with my forehead. Thursdays seem to be the most popular night (I work in the neighborhood and have to wander through the drunken piles of blonde extensions and popped collars on my way to the actual bus stop).

If you grew up in the Suburbs, or think the Suburbs are a nice place to visit once in a while, then Bus Stop is worth checking out.
author: Sachi T.

description:
You know you've had a good time when you can't remember what the hell happened or are drunk yelping.  

This is actually the second part of my WAKA review.  Our kickball league drinks here on Thursday and I can say I could not have had more fun here.  After about 30 rounds of beer cup flipping, I am convinced that the kickball league could be avoided and we could just head to this place with our kickball color shirts and play drinking games.  We just hung out in the back with other WAKA players and left the Gap wearing stripe shirt wearing douchebags and the Prada bag carrying blonde bimbos...(actually blonde bimbos aren't that bad) stayed in the front.

The place is small as $hit and the service was kinda slow now that I think of it, but hell, it was a Thursday night and we had a good time.
author: patrick o.

description: They stopped serving Coors in the can.  BUMMER!
author: William K.

description: If you are a Virginia Tech fan living 3,000 miles from campus... this is your only option for games not on ESPN360 in the bay area. For that, you get hella stars. Go Hokies!
author: Durand B.

description:
Ahh, the infamous site of Fajita-gate (just kidding)...

Decent casual hang-out bar.  Big bartender dude was really nice and friendly.  Pool tables in the back, and a jukebox that spits out 90s alternative works for me.  The only minor problem I had with the 3 draft beers I ordered was that none of them were all that cold.  My only suggestion would be to lower the temps on those keggers.  But all in all, I'd come back for sure.
author: Ash C.

description:
Simply put ,the Bus Stop is the best neighborhood bar  in the city... Its been a saloon for over 100 years. Jason and Ron are great bartenders who are always happy to help their customers. You will also find some of the best pool players in the city there. 

Become a Fan of The Bus Stop on Facebook!
author: Layne P.

description:
I'm agreeing with Mandy F. My Southern accent is pretty under control in SF, but there's something about that precious bartender pouring me a toddy at nine in the morning ... I give myself away everytime when I find myself saying "thank yewww!" That's about when he knows to pick up the remote to find the Ole Miss game for me. Bless his sweet heart. 

Wouldn't go at night, though. Best for sports during the day.
author: Jill C.

description:
I am new to the neighborhood and only live two blocks away from The Bus Stop, in fact my actual bus stop is right in front! I finally went to the Bus Stop with some buddies last night after some intermural game and I am so glad I did. It clearly is a fun, reliable, neighborhood bar, and the bartenders were significantly better than most of the other bars I have been to in the area. Not only did they make a good stiff drink, but they didn't put off that weird, pretentious, marina thing that's going around down here. 

I like it and I look forward to becoming a regular here!
author: LeeAnne T.

description:
Drinking here reminds me of being in college, so it's fitting that it is indeed the unofficial alumni bar for Hoyas. Also fitting are the buckets of Miller Lite (4 for $8) and groups of drunk guys (in khakis, flip flops, and baseball caps) to really drive home the fact that even though you're nearing your 30s, inside these walls you're forever 21.  

Several TVs strewn around the place make it impossible not to be watching some kind of sport (or lifetime movie with subtitles in the off-season) and pool tables in the back sometimes get converted into flip-cup tables during the kick-ball season. While the clientele often resembles the over-spillage from nearby Bar 'intelligent? witty? here you'll find' None--I do always have fun at the Bus Stop, taking on several buckets at a time.
author: Kelly R.

description: Best bar in the Marina, hands down.  Jason, Devon, and everyone there are friendly and there is an excellent tap beer selection.  Lively atmosphere and is an awesome place to watch Giants games.  Pool tables in the back and tables/booths to sit at in addition to the bar.  Can't say enough about this 100+ year old bar, if you every come by (which you should) you'll probably find me on the short end of the bar clutching a Lagunitas IPA and/or Racer 5 IPA watching the game after my shift
author: Zack H.

description: Great bar, even better bartenders and the prices are fair. I wish I could get a print out of all the money I have spent here, I'm in the market for a good cry.
author: Sean T.

description: Absolutely loved this place.  Was waiting for a bus, and turned around it noticed it was happy hour.  Crafty advertising!  I really enjoyed the vibe of the place, just a simple watering hole with good selection and deals.  Servers were friendly and attentive.  Definitely just a great all around hangout spot!
author: Chris W.

description:
Solid bar - especially on weekday nights.  Great place to meet up with buddies to watch a game and perhaps play some dice - also a phenomenal bar to saddle up to at about 4pm on a Monday and get stinky drunk (been done).  Careful of coming here on Fri & Sat nights and it can get too packed.
Overall (in my book), it's light years ahead of Bar None, a tad knotch above Mauna Loa but not quite at the level of Shanghai's or the M-Lounge.
author: Murray H.

description: Totally underrated place.  It's definitely a sticky floor kind of bar, but a great place to watch football games.  There isn't a bad seat (or place to stand) in the house because there are great flat-screen TVs everywhere...  And, unlike other Marina sports bars, it isn't too crowded so it's pretty easy to get a seat.  The place is small, but the waitresses are good about coming back to check in on the beer situation.  I also appreciate the fact that they let you bring in outside food (slices from Extreme Pizza!).  Good, relaxed crowd (another patron gave us her two leftover cans of beer!).  I'd heard the place was a big Georgia bar, but it was pretty filled with Michigan and Cal fans last weekend...
author: Wendy L.

description: Loads of tvs, and decent drink specials. This is probably the best sports bar on Union Street, though Blue Light is good too. This place is extremely crowded during games, so if you want that atmosphere and live near Union Street this is your go to place. Was absolutely a riot here during the world series games last fall.
author: David K.

description: Do Not go here unless you are in college. If you are there, enjoying yourself and not in college, start asking yourself why you feel so darn comfortable among girls celebrating their golden 21st and the 35 year old men spitting game and sipping Amstel Light. Boo.
author: Dinelle L.

description:
Where was I?  Ah yes, the Marina.  But why was I here?

Well, in lieu of a Christmas party, it seemed easier to try a Christmas-themed pub crawl this year.  The trick was finding a neighborhood with plenty of holiday spirit.  Sure, Union Square has a big tree, but I was intrigued by the "Union Street Festival of Lights", which promised lots of lights and even a parade!

The parade was supposed to go until 9, but when we got there at 8:30, it was nowhere to be seen.  And the lights weren't anything that Noe or Haight didn't have.  I guess the moral is the advertise-y neighborhood gets the revelers.

Anyway, on to the drinking.  Bus Stop was first, and I figured it would be a gentle ease-in to the Marina scene, being early and all.  But this is a sports bar, and it was the night of the Big Game.  So the place was one big college football party, and it's fair to say I haven't been around this many young, corn-fed, non-ironic Americans in a long long time.  Clearly the Marina rumors are true.  Good drink menu with good prices, but non-Marinans have plenty other sports bars to choose from.
author: Wes M.

description: My favorite place to watch sports in the marina.....bartenders are  very friendly and  the waitress from vegas is super sweet!!  if your ever looking for action this is your spot.......actually, anywhere in the marina!! The triangle is always nice!
author: daniel c.

description: Big Ron is the MAN!!!!  This is the quintessential neighborhood bar - where everyone knows your name.  And I'm not gonna lie, they had me at "free popcorn".  Also, being the Giants fan that I am, anywhere that does 50 cent PBR's after a win is ALL good in my book.
author: Daniella S.

description:
Oh bus stop....
This place literally lives up to its name....
You somehow always end up here somewhere along your bar crawl. Its not usually first, its not usually last, but for some reason when your trying to recall your night in your tequilla haze you remember that one cocktail you had at bus stop....hopefully =)

Either way, love the pool tables in the back(when their open!!! which actually isn't too difficult if you get there on the early side). And for some reason I find that little window in that area oh so amusing... 
Its like bartendar in a box. Awesome.
author: Stacy L.

description:
It's impossible to say enough wonderful things about this home away from home!  

My sanctuary during the month of October/MLB playoffs, and my morning ritual for the early morning Sunday football games.  A place where a young innocent girl like me can just walk in, sit down at the bar by herself, enjoy some $2.50 Highlifes, watch the games, chat with the older locals/regulars and get the royal treatment from the bartenders.  

It's a special bar that offers more then just a comfy and safe feeling for me to go to when I'm in the mood for sports, but also where I met my sweet bf.  It IS possible to meet your life-mate at a bar!!  I am living proof and even though I was meeting another guy there the night we met and left the bar to go to another bar with him, I came walking back to my now bf of 8 months, after the other dude confirmed of being the ultimate douche bag with an ego bigger then his head.  

It was a magical night that I will never forget (and the most horrible hangover the next morning), but I made the best decision ever by returning home to the Bus Stop that night.  I/We go back every now and then and the smiles on the bartenders faces when we walk in is priceless and makes us feel special for meeting at such a wonderful place with a big heart.

Thank you BS for changing my life in SF for the better.
author: Ayrn H.

description:
Bus Stop supports the Hokies + I love the Hokies= I love Bus Stop

Great place for college football. They put up with all our drunken VT cheers and keep the buckets coming. Can't complain about that.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
This is a Roxanne, Red Light kinda place.  Whiskey, light beer, pool, some, games on the tube, coed kickball teams getting trashed on a Sunday after their game....what's not to like.  Don't go here if you're more dressed up than jeans and a t-shirt.  This place is casual.  

Fun though.
author: John M.

description:
It's really difficult to review bars.  So, the location of the bus stop is primo Union street, yuppy kinda area.  Like any other bar they have all the requisite beers, but they have a LOT of them on tap and they have the taps lined up as a gimick.  It works.  

 like the place, I just can't get excited about four walls, neon lights, and 6 dollar beers.
author: Amir B.

description:
updated 5 years later:
Yep - this place still got it!  

=========

Great drink specials just about any day of the week...

Tons of TVs and some great old timers to hang out with.

Rick pours a stiff drink...and watch out, magic is known to happen on Saturdays...$3.50 jager shots...MK is with me on this one!
author: Ken S.

description:
I can't complain about this place.  it's a neighborhood bar with tv screen here and there and kick butt HAPPY HOUR!  Two shots of Grey, 2 bottled beers, and 2 cape cods for $15, you can't complain!!

Love the pool tables is the back and the fact that there are sreens at each corner so u can watch the game while playing a game.  One thing I don't like, the fact that guys, young and old, get crazy generous and talkative when two asian girls are drinking and playing pool.  All of a sudden, there is a line to play winners on our table, while the poor guy on the other table were looking for players!  Would go back for sure, but I have to remember is bring a guy friend next time so other people won't constantly interupt our night out
author: Wendy K.

description:
I have lots of reason why I love the Bus Stop but meeting my fiance there isn't what you came to read about. So instead, let's talk about there Friday HH with Harp on sale at 2.00 a pint. Always a fun place that gets packed but also chills out even on the busiest nights. One of my favorite things about this place is the history. This is a true SF establishment here with close to 100 years of service.

I no longer live in the city but when I am in the Marina - this is one places you might see me at.
author: Jack H.

description: I like to hate on all things Marina but I really can't hate on this place. Every time I go to the Bus Stop I have a great time. Beer buckets and all the free popcorn and pretzels you can eat, not bad. I'd like to thank the staff for not yelling at us for throwing popcorn all over the pool table area -- Tosh.O imitations...sorry!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
The absolute best place to watch a game!  The Bus Stop is part of my favorite Saturday:

Play a game of AM hoops
Grab a cup of coffee and read the Chronicle Sports Page 
Head to the Bus Stop
Watch Big Ten Hoops at the Bus Stop
Have a Bloody Mary
Have a few beers
Stroll the Marina 
Grab lunch - preferably sit outside and enjoy the sun

A great start to any day!
author: Todd S.

description:
Went there once with my boyfriend and his friend. I thought the place was chill and had some great drink specials, $1.50 domestics and $2.50 imports from 4-6pm. Typical sports bar with pool tables and TVs to watch the game.

Update(4-20-2007): Cheapest bar in the Marina to get so drunk you don't remember how you got home! They had Kamikaze shots and apple martinis for like $3.50 a pop. The bartenders are soooo friendly and the jukebox selection isn't too bad. This place is my favorite bar in the Marina!
author: Jenny C.

description:
Lots of Boston fans, lots of seating, pretty cheap beer. As a Boston expatriate, I have to say it's the best place in the city to watch the Red Sox or Pats. 

Good, loud crowd and beer specials include Red Stripe & Miller (neither are my preferred choices, but when they throw them 5 in a bucket and charge $15, I'll take it.)
author: Tim I.

description:
A sportsbar.  The only thing that makes this place special is that Georgetown alums always gather to watch basketball games here.  

Tip: Don't order food from around the area to the bar -- the minimum orders are WAY high.  Just walk down the street and get some pizza or crepes.
author: Danny C.

description:
Although I'm not a fan of the normal clientele that calls this place home I had to give it at least 3 stars for the Bar tender. While talking to a somewhat intoxicated young women she, unbeknownst to me, knocked over my freshly poured pint.  Shortly after she was ushered away by her gaggle of friends and I turned around to find my pint spanning the length of the bar... drats.... 

Well I was somewhat intoxicated as well and was throughly confused by this sudden loss of all that mattered to me at the time. Next thing I know the Bar tender brings me a new pint and tells me, "hey she knocked it over, here's a new one on the house" As you guess he got a huge tip.

He even allowed me to wake up my friend a few times who was passing out at the bar instead of just kicking us out like most would have done.

So 3 stars for the bartender, 0 stars for the patrons.
author: Donovan N.

description:
For those of you who don't live in the Marina, yes, weekend nights are going to suck, and they are going to be filled with more striped shirts than you can count. 

For those of you who do live locally, and are not the bridge-and-tunnel crowd, it's a great place to go when it's not ridiculously overpacked on Fridays and Saturdays. Great drink specials every night, pool tables in the back, enough TVs showing everything from football, to soccer, to even surfing and snowboarding. Bartenders are really nice, and you can't beat the prices. If this place is within walking distance for you, it's always a nice place to come when nothing else is going on.
author: Mike T.

description: This place is a very nice neighborhood sports bar. There are to many televisions to count that show to many games for even the most fanatical fan to keep up with. Drinks are well made and reasonably priced. They have a good local following as well as many out of towners that frequent when they are in town. Just ask for Rockin' Ron and he will show you a good time.
author: Mike K.

description: So I went to the bus stop after work on Friday night with a bunch of Marina Girls from the marketing/p.r./sales department at work... Yeah, so what,  sometimes I smoke with them outside. Anyway, so they took me to this bar full of douchebags. Here's the thing about douchebags... they're not so bad. They buy you drinks. Plus, this place has Bon Jovi on the jukebox. I thought that was pretty freakin' awesome. Something else that's cool about the Bus stop, there's actually a bus stop right in front of it. There's no irony there. It's no Mission Hipster bar full of sarcasm.
author: Ahnui Y.

description: A neighborhood favorite! Great beer on tap and I love the monthly cocktail specials. Gets very packed & no matter how you try the door guy will not let you in. No matter what you say!  A fun place if you are able to get there early.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Be prepared to be close to people. This bar is very small but also very cool. I've lived near this place for 20 years and just now went to it last night. Drinks were ok prices... 8.50 for a long island. While ive had much better mix drinks in Chicago, this place wasn't so bad. The waitress was terribly nice and gave my friend water after it was obvious she had too much to drink. There is a cool looking cupcake store that apparently open end in may right next to it. Nothing like a good cupcake after a night of drinking!!!! By the way union is filled with frat boys-and guys who were obviously not in frats but try to act like they were. A major turn off, but it's close to my house.
author: Patrick M.

description: I went here last week for an Alumni Event to watch a Hockey Game.  The happy hour is solid with reasonable prices on drinks.  It's also not too crowded (this was on a Friday between 5-8).  Pretty friendly service from the staff.  Our waitress was pretty attentive, not to mention pretty cute (not factoring her cuteness to the review).  They also came around with free Popcorn and Pizza at one point in the night.  A good place to go to hang out with friends and watch a game for sure.
author: Peter W.

description:
Oooookay, so I owe the B-Stop a good review cause I was a cotton-headed ninnymuggins on Wednesday night. Quiet you, Wednesday's the new Saturday- at least when you're a kickballer. So, sit down Indian-style in a circle kids, Auntie Annie has a story!

It all started on the kickball field, where I tend to regress to a college freshman mentality and have too many adult juice boxes. Cut to the afterparty at Kezar, where team Kick-In-A-Box dominates in flip cup. But this fateful evening, some English gents refused to relinquish the flipcup table, 'cause they were watching their precious soccer match. Puffs. So we mosey over to Bar None, in hopes of acquiring an arena for our flip cup shenanigans. Alas, the other league had commandeered all tables. The situation appeared hopeless- until I had the bright idea to abuse my Bus Stop connection (I used to work there slangin' cocktails). I herd my team over, and Ron gives us the green light to turn a few tables into our own little flippy cup venue. All started out fairly tame- until I got a little too competitive and, um, started wrestling all the dudes on my team. We're talking no holds barred, choking out, kicking and punching WRASSLIN'. So... sorry teammates for your newly acquired bruises, and a big "my bad!" to the 'Stop. I'd like to say it'll never happen again, but I don't want to sit on a throne of lies.
author: Anna K.

description: Drink specials every night?  $2.50 pints of Harp?  $5 Belvedere Martinis?  No bullshit? Count me in!!!
author: Erin L.

description: This place spelled L-O-V-E for me and my boyfriend! Maybe it was the great bartender Rick, maybe it was the darkhazzy bar on that Saturday morning, or maybe it was the $3.50 jager shot special, but magic happened at the Bus Stop. It is my local oasis in the Marina where you don't have the pretentiousness of East Side West or Balboa, and you dont' have the immaturity of Bar None or City Tavern, you are somewhere in between and is it awesome!
author: michelle k.

description: Bus Stop is awesome, especially on a weeknight.  The bartenders and servers are great and will put on any game you request {even when it's a Sacramento Kings game...trust me}, they pass around Amici's pizza for free, and have cheapo drink specials. AND if you are there for a pub quiz night and do well, you get fun little drink tokens you can take with you to use next time!
author: Kelly B.

description: I like the bus stop.  It's my favorite place in the marina to watch sports because it's not just college students and it's not usually as busy as bayside.  The one downfall is that they don't have food but you can order in if you want.  Every time I've asked them to put a game on they have been really helpful and put it on one of the big screens.  One time we were there the bartender ordered a pizza and gave some to everyone sitting at the bar.  The bathroom is TINY because I'm really tall and I can barely sit on the seat because my legs are long.  Also, if you've stand on the sink you can look down into the guys bathroom which is sort of funny.....not that I've done that or anything.
author: Jessica H.

description: Full of frat boys and girls - or their wannabes.  We actually couldn't stand it and so we left our unfinished beers.
author: A L.

description: I've been here so many times, but it's always to meet up with friends.  Forget the friends (sorry) I'm going back for the maitais!  They're huge, cheap and made me feel like I wasn't in SF, but instead enjoying a wonderful, sticky hot beach.  Plus, they go sooo well with the free popcorn stashed in the back.  Pure class.
author: Crystal K.

description: The Bus Stop is a quirky little bar.  It's got a mellow vibe, that bubbles just under rowdy, but may at any time bubble over.  Two pool tables make it extra cool.  Going to the women's bathroom feels like being on an airplane - your knees are touching the wall, literally!  It's the kind of place where 20 Santas just may, and in fact, did, walk in.
author: Amme P.

description: The least annoying bar on Union Street in my opinion. I won't really say much more than that because I've only been a handful of times on various pub crawls, but overall it seemed decent and like a good spot to grab some beers with friends.
author: Chris B.

description: Dont like it here, its all the people that make the marina suck on fridays and saturdays and none of the ones that make it rock the rest of the time!
author: Tom V.

description: Good happy hour.  Great location.  Lots of history on the walls.
author: Ben U.

description: I watched the USC/Cal game here after stumbling down the street from the OSU/Michigan game at another bar. It looked good and had a good crowd so why not?  And we had a blast despite the fact that I really, really wanted USC to lose (not so much for Cal to win, just USC to lose). Yea, it felt like a B&T type of crowd, but so what do you expect, you're on union street on a weekend. And as bad as you could claim the crowd is/was, who gives a crap if they're not bothering you let the frat boy douchie wannabes be frat boy douchie wannabes. Sometimes eclectic is bad, which is why this place gets four stars for not being that.
author: Joe K.

description: So I actually love this place. I love 5 bud lights in a bucket of ice for $11. I love that a whole bar had a bet on how old some crazy cracked out chick was. I love that everyone bet over 35 and it turned out she was 31.... she looked 45. I love we easily found a seat without thinking twice and that I was able to sit and watch the NBA All Star game with my friends and sister.
author: Nancy B.

description: Great specials every day, and the pours on the drinks are very nice to say the least. The abundance of large Flat Screens is a bonus, as are the pool tables and plenty of seating...
author: Nicolas H.

description: What a sausage fest!  In other words, LOVED IT.  Ladies, come here for cheap drinks, games, and eye candy!!  The drink specials are quite generous...I had multiple dirt cheap vodka tonics with Belvedere.  I would've given this place 5 stars, but no one mingles, and what can I say?... I like making friends after I've had multiple intoxicating beverages.
author: Julie N.

description: Rick is a super cool bartender first of all. Secondly this place has a really good vibe going most of the time. People usually come in here to watch sports or after work to hang out, and it really is not that bad. Its  fun with a group to come during the day and catch a game. You can play pool in the back too. Overall its just got a good vibe and you don't really get that "I'm definitley in the marina" feel when you are inside.
author: Ash D.

description: This is the FIRST bar i ever set foot in the first time i came to san francisco, so it is memorable in itself.  But i will say that its a nice little bar to catch up with friends, make new ones, or just play a few rounds of pool.
author: Michelle M.

description: So if I had to go to any bar in the Marina, I guess this is the one I'd choose.  Mostly because it's a total dive and they have buckets o' beer.  It's pretty laid back and mellow.  Plus you can have any food delivered there, ie Jakes Steaks.  Good spot to watch games.  And take John Carr bombs.
author: Lauren M.

description:
i was the only brown person in the building.

on a thursday night expect :
 - many frat/marina/drunk off $11 bucket of coors guys
 - kickball teams sporting their hipster pride
 - excessive testosterone in a small enclosure
 - no place to sit between the hours of 930 & 11
 - flip cup in the back & beer everywhere : don't wear nice shoes
 - age range: barely legal with fake id - i just got my first job in the real world

they earned an extra star because i whooped ass at flip cup.
author: Madhu D.

description:
i like beer and sports and drinking beer and watching sports with other people who like beer and sports.

and i don't really like sports. i just said that to fit in.
author: Jessi B.

description: The Bus Stop is a major hang out for some great pool players.  The staff is amazing and there is always some good games on.  That's just a few reasons that I love, love, love this bar.  You can find a good pool game going on any night of the week.  I especially like the afterwork happy hour crowd.  What great spot to slug back a few wines while decompressing from work.
author: Angel L.

description: Beer is important to me. I like to take care of it, and can't stand to see it wasted. That's why I was so sad this past Saturday when my friend accidentally knocked a pint out of my hand as I was coming back to the table. When I went to grab some napkins from the bartender he not only asked if I was OK (he'd seen it all go down) but prompty poured me another pint. Definitely a plus for service as far as I'm concerned.
author: Jesse E.

description:
one of my fav bars in the city! being that my ex was the one who brought me here first, i can't completely hate him.

1. HAPPY HOUR! half off the drinks and they don't skimp on good stuff
2. tv's EVERYWHERE! (i like to keep track of my  teams)
3. pool tables (yes plural not singular)
4. video games for the kid at heart
6. HAPPY HOUR! wait, i already said that (oh check the daily specials...$8 for bucket of beer)
5. jukebox with a good selection of music (rock to rap to pop)
6. eye candy...what ever flavor you like, good chance you'll find one here!

CHEERS!
author: Lola L.

description: LOVE this bar. I always come with friends but the times that I haven't, I've made friends pretty easily. There are pool tables in the back if you wanna play and other times they have flip cup available - who doesn't LOVE flip cup?! You're crazy if you don't b/c its a great way to meet people, get wasted and have a blast all in about 15 minutes :o)
author: Lindsay M.

description: years ago, i used to drink here. pretty interesting place with interesting people.
author: Victor G.

description: I heart this place... it's definitely on of my favorite pubs in the city. There's 2 tables to play pool and they also have some arcade games. the employees there are super nice (one looks like Ryan from the O.C.) and they always have some kinda deal.
author: Ashley C.

description: I love this place because it's conveniently by the 45 bus stop AND they have great drink specials, thus preventing both drunk driving AND bankruptcy. It's one of those no-frills bars--nothing special--but always a great backup when you have no idea where else to go. I'm not one to get dressed up every weekend and sometimes I just feel like wearing my jeans and T-shirt while enjoying some beer on tap. Some nights it's pretty chill, but on the weekends it can get kind of rowdy. Take your pick.
author: Natalie T.

description: This is a fun bar on Union St. with some of the best happy hour deals I've ever seen! Sunday evenings, 75 cent beers, and after a Giants Win? 25 cent beers! You really can't beat that, even at the supermarket!! There's a pool table in the back, and has about 3 rooms total. Fun place.
author: Jon N.

description: The beer is pretty cheap.  Tons of tvs to distract you from the fact you are in the Marina.  Probably a good place to watch a game.  But no food though!
author: Marcus E.

description: I come here rather more frequently than I would like due to coercion by some of my friends. However, it's often better than being dragged to places like Bar None which are way too hectic for me. The service is good - I really can't fault them here. I just get tired of how nasty the bathroom is and how generally dirty the place seems to be. It could be the clientele, but this place has a distinctly dingy vibe. I'd say - fun every once in a while, tiring if indulged in too often.
author: Sven S.

description: The first time i came here was when i was visiting SF and i thought it was a decent sports-bar. i was able to watch the games i wanted. There was a softball league that was there that night celebrating (don't get me started on rec softball players wearing full on gear) winning the Union St cross town, I hit a triple cuz the chic in the outfield couldn't catch the ball trophy. They had the whole back where the pool was and they were playing flip-cup. Awesome!!! That is not why i only gave 3 stars. That is because when baseball is on the most obnoxious of ALL fans descends on this establishment. I'm talking about Red SUX fans. Hey dip-shits there are 150 + games left it will be okay if they didn't execute that sac bunt. Seriously, they make Colombian soccer fan look sane.
author: Stephen K.

description: I stopped in here for a couple of drinks on my birthday and this place is great! I wish I could come back more often to take advantage of the drink specials, but I don't live in the neighborhood. Anyway, we had great service, enjoyed the music and of course the beverages!
author: Caroline S.

description:
When I lived in the Marina I walked by here often but had never gone in. One time a group of guys who were standing outside the door tried to persuade my girlfriend and I to enter Bus Stop. I was reluctant, feeling a bit tired and cynical for the whole, "Hey, what's your name?" thing. My friend talked me into it.
"We'll only stay twenty minutes!" she said. I agreed when she threw in a beer to the deal.

What I liked about this bar was how friendly the staff was. There seemed to be some regulars in here too which gave it a chill vibe. There wasn't anything uppity or snobby about it at all. I wish people were more into "mingling" instead of sticking to their own group at Bus Stop.

We ended up staying longer than 20 minutes. My beer turned into several. We had good times.

Bus Stop is your average neighborhood sports bar, but it has something to it that makes it better than the rest. I don't know, it's just a fun time.
author: Nicole R.

description: Definitely 5 stars for taking care of the Hokies during football season - the staff really knows how to treat their regulars.  I'm also a huge fan of the bucket-o-beer specials on Saturdays.  It felt strange to order a bucket of Red Stripe at 9am the first few times, but you get used to it.
author: John H.

description: Not the ideal spot for a big group of pubcrawlers since they stop letting people in while there's still plenty of room inside.  If you go, make it one of the first stops.
author: Rego S.

description: Horrrrrrible service! Door guys are a$$holes.  Who tells a group of four good-looking women that there is no more room in a bar when the bar is a cock-fest? Second time I went there, the older man who bartends there was a complete and total jerk.  Quality service for a QUALITY bar.
author: Courtney M.

description: Good, just plain old good. Decent drinks, no froofroo crap, fairly priced. Order food in from around the neighborhoood...
author: David R.

description: This place has some deals on certain nights. MGD high life is 2 bucks on Friday nights which is a deal even though it is MGD. The bartenders are quick and there were 3 of them.
author: Darius A.

description: In the heart of the Marina with a lot of people in their mid to late twenties hanging out over here.  They offer your usual beers on tap and hard liquors and also a special of  four 16 oz miller and bud lights in a bucket for about $8.  It is definitely great when you bring a group full of people who are down to drink some cold ones and end up ordering about three to five buckets.  Throw in some drinking games like flip cup, which they have in the back along with some popcorn and pretzels, you are definitely set for the rest of the night.
author: Kris A.

description: Love this place.  Finally got to drop by this place last weekend with some friends and had a great time.  The drink specials here are oustanding and just a great place to chill at with friends watching a few games going on.  Even better, its in a great location near other great bars and rests.  Definitely will be back.
author: Charles C.

description: Good drink specials. Lots of good TVs for sports. Decent space. Crowd wasn't my type though... To say the least, I saw 2 'I heart Marina Chicks' T-Shirts while there buried within crowds of popped collars (le sigh!).
author: linda t.

description: "So do you..." that was a line we used for a few girls here... Its ok... Marina Crowd, few good looking girls it gets better after you have been bar hopping.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
here is what i did at the bus stop:

went inside
took a jager bomb
danced around for 5 minutes
left

it seemed like it would be a fun place to chill!
author: Jessica B.

description: Definitely the best on a street of bad.  The barkeep is money and popcorn ad pool table are huge.  Sometimes a goober crowd but its a respectable joint for a Giants game and its was rocking when the Sox took the series.
author: Porfirio R.

description:
OK. 

I'm not really sure what to make of this bar. 
First off, i'll say that the drinks are cheap. 
Then...i'll say...the crowd is Very interesting. Here's a rundown of the characters on a Friday night
1) A visibly strung out middle age guy was hitting on my friend when i first walked into the bar. He had coke on his upper lips. WHY my friend would still chat with him is beyond me
2) There were quite a few OLD people sitting at the bar, visibly Drunk off their arses.  When i say Old, i mean, these were 70-80 year old folks. 
3) One of these women stumbled out around 9p and almost got run over by the MUNI. She then hit on a middle age man and proceeded to hang on to him like a koala on an eucalyptus tree
4) Another one of these Men, helped his equally drunk, old friend out of the bar to catch a cab...only to stumble right back to the bar for Another drink. It was painful to watch
5) Then, Coke guy came back and proceeded to tell us that he has 7 GFs and wanted to know if we were 'interested". GROSSSSSSS

Needless to say...i'll only return if i'm looking for entertainment on a very Slow week. 

Interesting
author: Jocelyn L.

description: It's hazy, but I believed I stopped in here once with Nish to do a shot of Jagermeister or Dr. McGillicuddy  or some other such nonsense shot just to make us all the more drunk. Yup. That sounds about right.
author: Michael E.

description: Great daily drink specials, chill atmosphere, and a killer jukebox.  Seems like a good place to hang out and watch games during football or baseball season.
author: Catherine K.

description: Thanks for actually serving until 2am.  Good bar, just a little too packed most of the times I've stopped by.  Don't go out of your way, but if you're walking by and it looks decent, check it out.
author: Neil I.

description: I'm not sure why I haven't reviewed this place yet. Ron and Jason are my favorite! It's one of the only places on Union street that I frequent. Great drinks, great people, and TV's everywhere!
author: Lisa K.

description: Any place with sports, pool, and buckets of beer is a place I can call home.
author: Matt M.

description: good happy hour price, always end up here (when im in the marina) to watch the giants game.
author: Zachary B.

description:
pool tables, tvs, and beer.

your basic sports bar with action varying from surfing, wrestling, baseball, football, and even soccer.  a reasonable place for a post bowling league drink, but not really a place i would think of going any other night.  i will say that it was reasonably full on a monday though.

on this particular night, i overheard a conversation about the worst medical emergencies people had heard about.  it was kind of disturbing as you might imagine...lots of dismemberment coupled with objects going places they don't belong under any circumstances.
author: eric g.

description: I just don't fully understand this place...I've had some good times and I've had some - really wish the slimy, stinky guy, who is still in his suit from the night before and hasn't taken a shower would get out of my face ;) times. I feel like it's a very typical marina dive bar. I still try to keep an open mind though, I have had some funny times here. It's really all about the company your with! Right?
author: christina C.

description: Hit or miss, so bring people you like with you, don't expect to find them there. Last night there was an impromptu arm wrestling tournament between two girls which was higly entertaining. Probably a good place to watch a game and relax.
author: Barbara A.

description: My fellow Southerners and I gather here to watch SEC sports.  The staff is very accommodating for our impromptu gatherings.  I like the fact that they'll let you bring food in from neighborhood restaurants. I'm sure that it can get crowded during peak times, but honestly I'm rarely there during peak times since it seems like only the 11 am CDT games are televised...aka 9am PDT.   Woohoo...drinkin' and watchin' football at 9 am on a Saturday, now that's hardcore and definately Southern.
author: mandy f.

description: I came here to use the bathroom and grab a drink, but they don't take CCs...booo! So, I left and went to Bar None.
author: Charm N.

description: At night it tends to draw a younger, less rich, crowd than the other bars in the area. Fitting in to that group, means that I like the place. Drink specials too.
author: Jack O.

description: One of the better bars in the area.  when i have to go out in the marina/cow hollow i think this is one of the places i'd rather go.
author: Alyssa W.

description: #1of a four part crawl.  Classic bar decor, high ceilings in the two table pool room was pretty classy.  The ability to order from local eating restaurants is a useful feature.  The daily drink specials are nothing short of cool, e.g. $10 for 6 Tecate's on Mondays.  The beer buckets are a first for me to see this side of the border, it's reminiscent of how they do things down in Mexico.  Overall, a pleasant experience.
author: Sam N.

description: I came here looking for food but all I got was airplane-style peanuts and beer ... so I left.  There are TVs, a pool table and a decent crowd, so the place looks like it has potential.  i just didn't have that much fun when I came here, so I was left unimpressed.  And they don't serve food, just peanuts.
author: M P.

description: Bus Stop is a good hangout bar in the Marina. It's a good place to watch the game, hang out with guys and have a good time. The women in this bar are usually pretty cool for Marina standards (compared with the typical i'm an ex-sorority, living off of daddy girl).
author: Dan M.

description: Fantastic bloody marys and nightly drink specials. Good for  early in the night before heading to other bars.
author: Erin F.

description: Really like this place when it is not too packed.  Really fun place to go watch a game during the day.  I especially like that you can order food to it from the restaurants in the area.   Not a big fan of it when there are so many people you cant move and there is not a single place to stand without being in the way.
author: Amy B.

description:
When seniors in college, we had SF pub nights.  Buses would drive us up from the Peninsula and deposit us at the Bus Stop, and we were asked to re-board, same place, 2am, after carousing our collegiate selves around Union Street.  I always thought it was just so funny that they would drop us off and pick us up at the Bus Stop.  So funny.  Ha.

These days, I most remember the Bus Stop not as my pick-up spot (well, not in the sense I described above), but for the following three reasons:
1. The older gentleman behind the bar is really sweet (sweet?), and makes me liquid cocaine shots when I'm feeling self-abusive.  
2. I shot my best game of pool ever here (they have two tables).
3. They have TVs to entertain you sports fanatics, and pretty darn decent nightly drink specials to entertain the rest of us.
author: Hannah J.

description: I like this place. Maybe because most of my time spent in here is during daylight hours and the crowd is good. Great place to stop and grab a beer (or 4) and watch the game. It's also super close to my bff's house so we can stumble on home afterward for a nap before we conquer the City at night! ...Bloody Mary isn't too shabby either.
author: Erica A.

description: I love this bar, in part because it is conviently located two blocks down from my apartment.  The bar tenders are awesome and really friendly and they have great daily drink specials.  It's not the typical uppity marina bar and i've always had a great time.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: A little small.....gets crowded......but a really fun place!! Couple pool tables and some great drink specials every night of the week. Also a good place to watch a game!
author: tom h.

description: Had a great time here watching college football about two weekends ago.  There are other sports bars in the area, too, but this one didn't necessarily do anything wrong, and the atmosphere in such a place on  a Saturday afternoon is hard to beat, so it gets a decent rating.
author: Sam M.

description:
i really like bus stop because it has both marina people and locals but without the marina attitude that plagues some of the other places around the area (matrixfillmore cough cough).  

i definitely recommend the buckets of pacifico for 15 bucks, and also the bus stop car bomb drink.  not sure what exactly is in it, but it's pretty tasty and a fun thing to drink with your friends.  

nice place to come for a more relaxed night; people can come and eat food inside, they have ball games playing in the background.  

I've only gone to bus stop on thursday and friday nights, and it's usually not tooo busy but always fun.
author: Andrew L.

description:
UGA BAR!

Get there EARLY on Saturdays- I was there last weekend to check out the UGA Game and It was wall-to-wall packed. I think it's also a VT bar... 

Anyway, awesome drink specials, good crowd that gets into the games, and the bartenders are friendly- it was exactly the type of College Football bar I've been looking for.
author: Mark L.

description:
One of the only places I really go in the Marina.  It's a really laid back crowd for the most part.  You don't necessarily feel the pressure to wear a striped button down collard shirt.

They have different drink specials every day, so you can get away with a cheaper tab.  Wednesdays or Thursdays they have a cheap Skyy Vodka special ($2-3?).  And I think everyday they have a Bud/Coors/Rolling Rock bucket special of 5 beers for $11 or $12.

My favorite thing about this bar: COMPLIMENTARY Amici's pizza around 8 p.m. or so!  The bar just gets it delivered and then hands it out to anyone who wants it.  I LOVE IT!

There's a pool table and some pin ball machines and a couple flat screen tv's for your entertainment.

Overall, a laid back place to grab a drink or two and move on - or a good place for last call.
author: Liz T.

description: The bar is a pretty cool place, but what makes my visits to this fine establishment worth the trip every time, is the waitress/bartender Devin. Not only is she extremely efficient at her job, but just her mere presence makes coming to the bus stop a phenomenal experience! Devin is the best ever!
author: Thomas E.

description: Fun place to watch sports on the many many TVs with your friends. I never realized it was a V Tech hang out spot, but it was fun nonetheless.  Service is a bit slow, even at the bar, but the beers were cheap.  They do not serve food here so we ordered pizza from North Beach. Regardless of those issues it's a good place to go with a bunch of friends.
author: Po L.

description: This is a great place for catching any sports game. The bartenders are nice and the drinks come fast. During the weekends, there is an abundace of young professionals that haven't given up on their frat boy days and girls just trying to stay drunk to keep their sorority mindsets. It's certainly high school/college all over again. On the weekdays, you'll find retired Hemingway types that make for better conversation. The best way to enjoy this place is to seat yourself at the bar, near a tv and make way for the libations.
author: Cris M.

description: The Bus Stop is great for those Saturday college football games. There are good-looking sexy guys rooting for their Alma Matters. The drink specials are plenty, although I've never bought myself many drinks while hanging out. The drinks magically appear.
author: Johnna R.

description: i left this place 10 minutes ago and am convinced it's one of the worst bars ever.  yes, maybe a pubic hair better than bar none, but still ridiculous.  i live 2 blocks away and hadn't been for 3 or 4 years.  i wish i'd extended my streak but got dragged there for a b-day party.  the guys are all from the east bay, the girls are either 22 or complete bimbos, and it couldn't suck any more.  indeed, it has more testosterone than floyd landis.  avoid at all costs.
author: schnarf-a-larf a.

description: This review is about a year or so late . . . I used to bartend and I was pounding the pavement looking for bartending jobs after I lost my other job.  The bartender at Bus Stop was one of the only nice people on my never-ending search for a bartending job.  He seemed sympathetic to my search, said that it was really hard to find bartending jobs especially in that time.  Then a little old man next to me offered to buy me a beer.  He was so cute!  It was afternoon, though, and I wanted to finish doing that neighborhood, so I declined.  I really should have just sat down and had a beer with the man. .  who cares?  I needed it.  Anyway, most places I went to to job hunt - well it wasn't unusual for bartenders or staff to practically spit in my face if I dared ask "are you hiring?".  The women were always the worst.  But this day someone was actually nice, and didn't make me feel stupid just for asking, and that meant a lot to me.  Thanks, Mr Bartender!  :)
author: Muriel D.

description: 2 1/2 stars. I don't really get why this place is so popular. It wants to be a dive bar, but all the people in here have 7 jeans and popped collars. Plus it is so tiny and always packed to the gills. Bartenders are pretty friendly but it's usually impossible to get  a drink. It would be a good place to come watch sports, except that a) there is never anywhere to sit and it can be tough to stand, hold your drink, and cheer for your team for hours at a time and b) there are always some obnoxious wasted guys getting in fights over whatever game happens to be on. I guess this is where the Boston fans hang out because my roommate and her friend always go here to cheer for the Red Sox, which makes it even worse in my opinion, since their fans tend to be some of the loudest. Oh yeah and the bathroom? Quite possibly the worst design EVER. It is so narrow that your knees actually touch the wall when you sit down on the toilet.
author: Lindsey S.

description: MyGodwhataDUMP.  The odor of spilled beer and bleach and cheap perfume combined with the low-end, public school clientele will hit you like a brick wall upon entering.       This is where people come to drink shots and throw up outside.   This is where boys wear their trucker hats sideways and the Marina girl-wannabees walk around in cheap attire.  This bar belongs in another part of town - far, far away....
author: F. V.

description: came here on a tuesday night so it wasn't too busy.  the bartender was super nice and friendly (maybe because i'm a woman) but he was all smiles which made me pretty dang happy too.  drinks were strong and people seemed to be having a lot of fun.   good casual place if you don't like things too hectic.  got to play wheel in the sky on the juke box!  gotta have my journey
author: Tiffany L.

description: went here for the man-u/chelsea game because kezar pub was too packed and bayside is closed. had a great time! we got a couple buckets of miller(i think) and they were very cheap. they dont serve food, but they allow you to bring food in and even order food to be delivered to the bar. the staff was friendly and the fans were in attendance. and man-u won! played some pool in the back afterwards, and had some popcorn. im definately a fan!
author: Andrew T.

description: i like this bar.  although the bathroom is horrible.  but good drink specials.  fun people.  definitely a nice stop in the night.
author: jessie h.

description: Great local bar, but gets really packed during peak nights. We usually order a bucket of red stripe (5)  for $16.  Good luck finding a seat to enjoy it though. Plenty of drink specials everyday of the week. Bathroom is SUPER small.
author: Simon S.

description: friend took $100 from phil gordon playing rock, paper, scissors.
author: Kevin F.

description: Had a great time here on a Sunday in March. Came during the day, everyone there was super nice, cheap drinks, and it was actually pretty full. I love the fact that people in SF make Sunday the 3rd day of the weekend. Will def be back with a group of friends again.
author: Danielle M.

description: they have amazing drink specials every day of the week...i'm not usually a fan of bars in this area but this is one of the bars i can tolerate..i arrived closed to midnight in sf and decided that this would be the bar for me to go get wasted because it was walking distance from my hotel..the crowd is nothing to  write home about..there will always be middle aged men trying to buy younger women drinks and frat types with their friends watching sports...it's a sports bar, it's the marina, it's going to happen..that aside, they play good music, have about 5 different channels playing at once and their drinks aren't bad...if you're lucky, maybe a super drunk middle aged man will buy you and the rest of the bar a round of drinks (true story twice over)..score!
author: monica p.

description: good place to watch football and bball games. watch out for those crazy georgia peaches on football saturdays.
author: Dean E.

description: I signed up for Yelp just to review this place. I lived close to the Bus Stop for about a year and I think it is the thing I miss most about my old apartment. Crowd here is friendly and fun at the same time. All the people that work there are a fun group and most of the patrons become friends with the bartenders/waitresses/bouncers, of which most go to the bar even when they are not on their shift.  The bus stop is really two bars in one: the back room with the pool tables and the bar/front room. The back room is usually where the regulars hang out. Most of them have been coming for years. The front room is the one that gets crowded on thurs/fri/sat nights. occasionally you have some douche bags from bar none or matrix fillmore come in, but for the most part the crowd is mellow and laid back. Drinks are good, specials are good. The only time I wouldn't want to come to the bus stop is on pub crawl nights when there isn't any pool. I live in San Diego now and go to a lot of bars down here but Bus Stop is still my number 1.
author: James R.
